item.title: Niger military leaders to nationalise uranium firm
item.description: The company is majority French-owned, while the junta wants more local control of Niger's mineral wealth.

item.title: US basketball training for Senegal cancelled after visas rejected
item.description: Players will train in Dakar instead "in a sovereign and conducive setting", says the prime minister.

item.title: BBC shelves Gaza doc over impartiality concerns
item.description: Gaza: Doctors Under Attack, which was due to air in February, was made by an independent company.

item.title: Zambian ex-president to be buried in South Africa after funeral row
item.description: Edgar Lungu's family has been engaged in a bitter dispute with the government over his funeral plans.

item.title: Israeli military kills 23 Palestinians near aid site in Gaza, witnesses and medics say
item.description: The Hamas-run health ministry says more than 400 Palestinians have been killed in this way since late May.
